module_restrictions: If you are admitted to GT as an undergraduate student, you must have specific permission to take graduate level courses.
visa_info: Visas can take several weeks to process. Students should apply for the J-1 Visa as soon as possible.
accommodations_info: Georgia Tech and the surrounding Atlanta neighbourhoods offer a wide variety of housing options to suit most preferences. Many Exchange students want a more standard US college experience and therefore choose to live on-campus. Others want prefer a bit more freedom and ease of living among Atlantans rather than students 24/7.
cost_of_living: Please refer to https://oie.gatech.edu/accordion-exchange-student-application - and scroll down to the Costs associated with GT Exchange tab for more information on the cost of an exchange at GA Tech.
university_description: Georgia Institute of Technology, also known as Georgia Tech is a public research university in Georgia, United States.
university_address: North Ave NW, Atlanta, GA, 30313, United States
location_cost_of_living: The cost of living in Atlanta, Georgia is relatively affordable compared to other cities in the United States.
location_weather: Atlanta has a humid subtropical climate with hot summers and mild winters.
location_description: Atlanta is a major city in the southeastern United States and is the cultural and economic center of the Atlanta metropolitan area. It is known for its role in the American Civil Rights Movement and has many attractions including the Georgia Aquarium, World of Coca-Cola, and CNN Center.
location_crime: Atlanta is considered to be a moderately safe city, but there are areas that experience higher crime rates.
location_transportation: Atlanta has a range of transportation options including public transit, taxis, ride-sharing services, and bike-sharing programs.
location_halal: There are several halal food options in Atlanta.
location_vegetarian: There are many vegetarian food options in Atlanta.
